answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some resources on form based zoning that be useful as a guide.
This is the Flagstaff, AZ City Zoning Code which includes a section on form based zoning procedures. 
http://www.flagstaff.az.gov/DocumentView.aspx?DID=14504
The City of Dublin, OH used a form-based code for their Bridge Street Corridor project. This website includes timelines and informational videos on their process.
http://www.dublin.oh.us/bridgestreet/form_based_code.php
Miami has taken on a similar project. You can view more information about it on their website below.
http://www.miami21.org/
This is an FAQ page on the Columbia Pike Form Based Code used in Arlington, VA.
http://www.columbia-pike.org/?page_id=303
I also included a brief form based code timeline from Temple, TX.
http://www.ci.temple.tx.us/index.aspx?NID=1259&ART=5452&admin=1
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Timothy McLean
text:
Recently our Planning Commission has elected to adopt form based zoning for our downtown area. I am interested in hearing from other communities that have adopted form based codes. In Jonesville, we are a community of around 2,300 people. I am particularly interested in hearing from Planners and Administrators in similarly sized communities. How did you go about development and implementation? Did you hire Planning Consultants for this process? What were the timelines for development and implementation? And finally, were you satisfied with the results after implementation? Any feedback on this subject would be beneficial. I am also available for phone and email communication as well. 
Tim McLean
Assistant to the Village Manager
Village of Jonesville
Services@Jonesville.org
(517) 849-2104
title: Form Based Zoning
